channel.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: US Elections News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: US Elections 2024 Latest Updates: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: ‘He was too strong’: Passenger attempts to open plane’s emergency door mid-air, see video
item.description: A Copa Airlines flight from Brazil to Panama experienced a harrowing near-disaster when a passenger, armed with a plastic knife, attempted to open the emergency door. Passengers bravely intervened, subduing the man until authorities apprehended him upon landing. The airline commended both the crew and passengers for their quick action in ensuring the safety of everyone on board.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Hurricane Rafael makes landfall in Cuba as a 'life-threatening' category 3 storm
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Democrats blame Joe Biden for Kamala Harris’ massive defeat in US elections
item.description: Kamala Harris lost the US election to Donald Trump, marking the second time Democrats lost to him. Biden's late withdrawal from the race due to health concerns and Harris's alignment with his policies are cited as contributing factors to the loss. The Democrats now face calls for introspection and change within the party.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sundar Pichai to Satya Nadella: How prominent Indian-Americans reacted to Trump’s win
item.description: Several prominent Indian-Americans congratulated Donald Trump on his re-election as US President. They expressed their eagerness to collaborate with his administration in strengthening US-India relations and advancing shared global interests. Figures like Vivek Ramaswamy, Sunder Pichai, and Satya Nadella were among those who publicly conveyed their well-wishes and support.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump Media gains post-election, even as Truth Social parent reports $19 million quarterly loss
item.description: Trump Media, the parent company of Truth Social, reported a loss of USD 19.2 million in the last quarter. The company attributed the loss to legal fees and declining revenue. Despite the financial struggles, the company's stock price surged following Trump's presidential win.

item.title: German govt in crisis as Scholz’s ruling coalition collapses: All you need to know
item.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz dismissed Finance Minister Christian Lindner, leading to the collapse of the ruling coalition. Scholz cited policy clashes and plans to seek a vote of confidence in January, potentially triggering early elections amid economic concerns and global uncertainty.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Our point of view won't always win’: Obama congratulates Trump after win
item.description: Former President Barack Obama congratulated Trump and Vance on their victory while acknowledging the disappointment of those hoping for a different outcome. He emphasized the importance of a peaceful transfer of power and urged Americans to address challenges with unity and grace. Vice president Harris also conceded, promising to continue fighting for the causes her campaign championed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Congratulations pour in, except from Russia
item.description: World leaders reacted to Donald Trump's election victory with a mix of caution and optimism. While some expressed hope for improved relations, others emphasized the need for unity and coordination in the face of potential challenges posed by Trump's policies.

item.title: Bibi's firing of Israel defence chief draws both ire & praise
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's dismissal of Defense Minister Yoav Gallant has ignited controversy and protests across Israel. Gallant's opposition to Netanyahu's handling of the Hamas war, particularly regarding a ceasefire and the Orthodox military exemption issue, led to his removal. Critics accuse Netanyahu of prioritizing political survival over national security, while supporters argue the move brings stability.

item.title: Trump's erratic foreign policy set to meet 'a world on fire'
item.description: As Donald Trump returns to the political stage, questions arise about his foreign policy plans. Supporters believe his strong personality will influence world leaders, while critics point to his past inconsistencies. Trump's approach to the Ukraine war, his support for Israel, and his stance on China will be closely watched.

item.title: Re-election set to stall criminal cases brought against Trump
item.description: Despite facing four criminal prosecutions, Donald Trump's election victory effectively halts legal proceedings against him during his presidency. While he can dismiss federal cases, the New York hush money case and Georgia election interference case may be delayed due to his presidential status.

item.title: 'Samosa Caucus' puffs up from 5 to 6 in Congress
item.description: Six Indian Americans, including Suhas Subramanyam, the first from the East Coast, have secured victories in the House of Representatives elections. The incumbent Indian-American members, Ami Bera, Raja Krishnamoorthi, Ro Khanna, Pramila Jayapal, and Shri Thanedar, all retained their seats. Amish Shah is also poised for a potential win in Arizona.

item.title: X-factor: Elon set to be Trump's Musketeer
item.description: Elon Musk, a staunch supporter of Donald Trump, celebrates the billionaire's return to the White House. Musk's influence is expected to soar in a Trump 2.0 administration, potentially securing him a role in shaping policy and overseeing government spending.

item.title: Barron anointed child, Melania jewel in crown: Expert decodes body language of Trump family members on Election Night
item.description: Body language expert Judi James said Melania's styling was corporate and her poses on Election Night were confident and strong. Barron who is remarkable for his 6'9'' height and is always the tallest person in every room, adopted an alpha pose standing alongside his mom and dad, the expert noted. Ivanka and Jared Kushner's importance has been diminished and thy were standing with JD Vance and Usha.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Unlike Nate Silver who will try to...': 'Nostradamus' Allan Lichtman says he was wrong
item.description: ​On Election Night, Nate Silver announced that he was pulling his prediction model because it wasn't "capturing the story of this election night well." Nate Silver washed his hands off his final prediction that it would be a close battle and re-upped his October prediction elaborating 24 reasons that Trump could win the election. "We don't lack in explanations for why he returned to the White House," Silver wrote.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: MAGA supporters enjoy The View's meltdown; Whoopi Goldberg refuses to take Trump's name
item.description: ​ "Think about this. She did this in two months. She [Kamala] did what she did. She was everywhere. She talked to everybody, and people didn’t come out. I don’t know why. And it doesn’t even matter. He’s now the president. I’m still not gonna say his name. That’s not gonna change," Whoopi Goldberg said on The View.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Donald Trump's ice maiden 'Susie' mentioned 7 times in his victory speech?
item.description: 66-year-old Susie Wiles was immersed in every aspect of Donald Trump's 2024 campaign. As Donald Trump described her, she is always in the background and likes to remain away from the limelight though she was with Trump at every crucial stop. Wiles traveled to Atlanta for the debate, flying to the event with Trump. She stayed with the former president as other campaign aides, and surrogates but she managed to stay away from the limelight.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US election results 2024: Donald Trump, the imperial president
item.description: Donald Trump's projected second term promises a radical reshaping of American society, with a focus on mass deportation, the curtailing of reproductive rights, and the consolidation of presidential power. His plans, some drawn from the controversial Project 2025, include overhauling immigration enforcement, potentially detaining American citizens based on national origin, and promoting Christian nationalist policies.
item.dc:creator: Chidanand Rajghatta

item.title: Trump has won the US presidential polls, what happens now?
item.description: Donald Trump, in his second presidential transition, is prioritising loyalty in his appointments, including figures like Robert Kennedy Jr. and Elon Musk. This transition, managed by family and close allies, contrasts with his 2016 approach. Despite legal challenges delaying the 2020 transition, new legislation now ensures a smoother process for future transitions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Kari Lake, Ted Cruz, AOC, Anna Paulina Luna win elections: Latest updates
item.description: ​Republican Ted Cruz, another closely watched senator, won a third term in the US Senate from Texas. He defeated US Rep Colin Allred. This was another election that pollsters predicted wrong as Ted Cruz was predicted to "lose for sure". ​The race tightened in the last few weeks as Allred spent millions of dollars on TV and digital ads criticizing Cruz for his support of the state's six-week abortion ban.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
